tagline: Colorado high country gravel from Ned Overend's hometown. Altitude included.

course.terrain_type: Colorado Front Range gravel with sustained climbing
course.terrain_surface: Maintained gravel roads, some chunky sections, forest service quality
course.signature_challenge: The altitude. Racing between 8,000-11,000 feet means your power is compromised. Pacing matters more than fitness.
course.character: Pure Colorado high country. Forests, peaks, and thin air. Intimate race with big views.

suffering_zones.label: First Climb
suffering_zones.desc: The altitude starts making itself known.

suffering_zones.label: High Point
suffering_zones.desc: Above 10,000 feet. Thin air, big views, hard pedaling.

suffering_zones.label: Final Descent
suffering_zones.desc: Fast gravel back to Nederland. Stay focused.

course.climate_description: Late August at 8,000-11,000 feet means cool mornings, warm midday, and afternoon storm risk

biased_opinion.summary: Ned Gravel is the intimate Colorado experience—no massive crowds, no lottery drama, just quality gravel in beautiful high country. Perfect for Colorado locals or those who want altitude racing without Leadville's intensity.

logistics.parking: Small-town parking. Arrive early for start area spots.

searchable_text: Ned Gravel Colorado high country gravel from Ned Overend's hometown. Altitude included. Pure Colorado high country. Forests, peaks, and thin air. Intimate race with big views. The altitude. Racing between 8,000-11,000 feet means your power is compromised. Pacing matters more than fitness.
